nadia_1_intro: ^This is a big year for me, since my A Levels are coming up.
^That’s going to decide whether I make it into medical school like I’m hoping, so... No pressure.
^I haven’t told a lot of people about the medical school thing. It all feels a bit impossible.
^But good grades have always kind of been my thing, so... Maybe, I have a shot.
^I’ve also got great study buddies! Chloe and Gavin, my best friends at school.
^JC life would be a lot worse without them around. Especially since I don’t exactly, uh, fit in.
^This is a Christian school, and there are barely any other Muslim or Malay students besides me.
^It’s fine though, I’m mostly used to it by now. When I need someone who just... gets it? I’ve got my cousin Azlin.
^She’s a nurse, so that’s very cool. We’re super close, and she always keeps it real.
^And this is what it’s like, to be me.
nadia_1_1_narration: ^9:45pm, but not an unusual hour to still be in school.
^I quickly hug my friends goodbye, and hurry to the driveway.
^My dad is waiting to pick me up.
nadia_1_1: ^There's food at home if you're  hungry, your mother made currypuffs just now.
nadia_1_1a: ^I'm sorry!! Your hoodie is still with me 😳
^yaaa forgot about night study today, didn't bring the winter wear
^I know. you were freezing in the library just now.
^I shall just bravely suffer. on this very cold
^So how many of you doing this "night study"? Quite a lot of people just now eh.
^Depends… Last year before promo exams, both the canteen and library got packed.
^It's a bit more chill for now.
^Kalau chill, kan study at home..(If it’s too relaxed, studying at home is better)
^I know, it's just easier to concentrate at school. At home, I just feel like sleeping —
^— are you sleeping enough? All these late nights are not good also.
^That's why your mother always ask me to pick you up.
^Was my friend's idea, so I asked Chloe to join us too.
^Oh this study group is not Chloe who start?

c-0: ^  It was my friend Gavin's idea. I know him from student council.
c-1: ^It's much easier than last year when I was trying to cram everything by myself.
g-0: ^I see. Your friends in this school.. the culture a bit different.
^Just different. They hug a lot.. always peluk-peluk (hug).
^Wait. I hugged Chloe goodbye just now. Which means..
^... he also saw Gavin hugging me.
^uh... Ya, a bit right? But it's just like that here.
^It's a convent school thing maybe, they just like to hug-hug, hello goodbye also hug, boy or girl also hug —
^But for us, it's not.. nice. Tak baik. Kan kita orang Islam. (Not nice. We are Muslims)
^If girl, okay la! Chloe or whoever.. but if boy, even if it is just a friend..
^Turn on the radio to distract dad

nadia_1_1b: ^Need me to bring any of my notes from last term tomorrow?
^lol what, so you have an excuse to be dramatic until when
^looks cute on you. I like it.
nadia_1_1c: ^Oh look! Just in time, Misteri Jam 12..
^Abah, you don't pretend! You love these as much as I do.
^At least after I watch scary movies, I can still sleep at night.
^Some people will sleep with the lights on.. who does that ya?
nadia_1_1d: ^Finally, home! What a landmine of a drive.. maybe next time I should pretend to sleep.
^Later go say goodnight to your mother ok?
^She probably still waiting up for you.
^Yeah she messaged me earlier just now.
^Said she had something to pass to me. Do you know anything about it?
nadia_1_2_narration: ^Friday morning, packing my things for school. We’re having PE today.
^Track pants or PE shorts? Track pants la.
nadia_1_2: ^I am actually a bit nervous now that I am in these track pants.
^That’s so weird. It’s okay to look a bit different!.. right?
^Wow, Chloe is really taking this Asian beauty skincare thing seriously.
^That’s a lot of sunblock she’s laying on.
^I just don’t want to get too tanned, you know?
^Never too young to start sun protection, that's what my mom always says — oh!
^Yes Chloe, I know, the penetrating and damaging rays of UV —
^No, I mean, how come you're wearing track pants?
^I feel more comfortable in these, actually
^Hahaha maybe I just need more UV protection for my legz!

nadia_1_2a: ^I feel more comfortable in these, actually. My mom just got them for me.
^Really? It looks a bit warm, don't you think?
^Yeah they are, a bit. But that's just the material.
^Well, do you want to borrow my shorts? I have an extra pair.
^It's clean, don't worry. I brought them for hockey later —
^No, as in, I FEEL more comfortable in these pants, and not.. shorts.
^I don't understand. You just said they were warm and not comfortable.
^Wait, is this about, like, showing too much?

g-0: ^Oh. You know you have nothing to be ashamed of right?
^All bodies are beautiful, and honestly, you have GREAT legs —
^Hahaha...Ok, ok you don't have to go all hashtag body positivity, I get it.
^I just.. don't like showing so much skin.
^And you're right, thank you, I DO have great legs.
^But I think I don't like being super conscious —
^... Nadia, you are hardly a narcissist. Your IG is cat pictures.
^But my point is, I like being modest. I like covering up. It.. quiets my mind.
^I CARE about how I look, but I would like to care a bit less. You know?
^So you can focus on other things.
^Yes, exactly. Figure out who I am, in my head, in my heart.
^What I want to do after A's.. Everything else —
^... is fluff. Ok I get it. It's like that in hockey too when we're training for A Divs.
^Yeah, clarity. I think that's what religion is about. And discipline with self.
^At least, that's what I think of being Muslim.
^Will you wear a hijab one day? Or is it tudung? Did I get that right?
^Both names are okay. My mom started wearing a tudung when I was in primary school.
^I wear a tudung also actually. Most times. Sometimes.

c-2: ^ (Laughs) I don't know Chloe, I am also figuring it out.
c-3: ^ Hmm... I really don't know Chloe, I am also figuring it out.

g-1: ^I had no idea you wear a tudung outside of school..
^Do you think the other Malay girls in school also wear a tudung?
^Chloe, there are only two other Malay people in this school, and they are GUYS.
^Yup! Now can we go? I don't need Mrs. Ee to shoot us her laser eyes for being late. That woman —

nadia_1_2b: ^Track pants! Immediate protection against the sun, SPF 1500 guaranteed.
^Haha, very funny Nad. Just because I don’t want to get too dark..

g-0: ^Ok but seriously though, what’s up? Is it your parents again?
^But you gotta admit that they’re a bit controlling.
^Like your mom not wanting you to get “too tanned” or “too dark”?
^Exactly. You have to draw the line with moms.
^You were fine wearing shorts for PE, why are they making such a fuss?
^I got them in the uniform’s colour.

c-2: ^They didn’t make a fuss. I actually thought it was a good idea.
c-3: ^Ok, but I did get them in the same colour as our school shorts.
^Wait, you bought them? This was your idea?

g-1: ^Yes, it was my idea Chloe. And they’re just track pants.
^My mom brought it up, I liked the idea, cleared it with the Teachers. Voila.
^Nothing. I didn’t think you were that conservative too.
^I don’t know. That you were more modern. I mean, you’re not like other Malays.
^Anyway, let’s go. The last time I was late, Mrs Ee made me run extra laps.

nadia_1_2c: ^My mom got them for me. They look ok?
^Wait, when did this happen? How did you get pants in the same material as our shorts!
^A lot of hunting and endless picture sending on WhatsApp.
^Almost. Was just a random idea I had, and she just wanted to help. A lot.
^You don’t seem that keen on it though?
^They look fine though! And you don’t look weird.
^I’m not going to lie, but is it that big a deal? Do you want to borrow some shorts instead?

c-0: ^  Yeah. Just wishing I wasn’t like, one of the three Malay students in our year.
c-1: ^ I mean.. I just wish I wasn’t like, one of the three Malay students in our year.
g-0: ^I know. Are you friends with them actually? You never mention them.
^Kinda, I only see them at Malay class and that’s it.
^Definitely not. OKAY let’s go before they make us run extra laps!

nadia_1_3_narration: ^In the quiet window of time after class hours, I’m by myself in the canteen, grabbing a meal.
^After all of that PE, I’m starving.
nadia_1_3: ^Canteen! Having early dinner, super hungry after PE
^Yes, yes, Nadia and Chloe, joined at the hip.
^The guy who speaks in third person?
^Don’t tell me you know him too!

g-0: ^The world is blessed. Gimme a min, let me grab some food.

nadia_1_3_whatsapp1: ^Nad what time are you gg to be home today?
^Probs be at night study again. What’s up?
^no biggie. am clearing leave + might drop by your place
^😏😏😏 my mum said she making ayam masak merah
^ok in that case CONFIRM i will swing by for dinner
^heh no promises. see u if i do :)
nadia_1_3_part2: ^Ok I’m back, what did I miss! Is that Chloe?
^No, it’s my cousin. Chloe’s at a hockey thing. What are you having?
^Bak chor mee. The other stalls closed up already.
^I like it when Gavin says grace before a meal, quietly. He talks so much nonsense usually.
^This side of him… this peacefulness makes sense to me.
^You know. We do that too. Saying grace before a meal.
^Yeah. Sometimes you move your lips when you think no one is watching.
^I did not know I do that.
^You do it a lot. When you’re doing equations, when a queue takes too long, when Chloe is late-
^— ok, thank you very much. Does everyone know too?

c-0: ^Ha, I knew it! You’re only vague when you’re avoiding something.
^Fine, but you are only half-right. She is at hockey, but I don’t know when she’ll be done.
c-1: ^You’re being strange. Did something happen between you two?
g-0: ^Maybe? I don’t think so. It’s weird.
^Definitely. I’m sure it’s just a misunderstanding. Right?
^I looked up NUS the other day.
^Oh yeah! So what are you thinking -  NUS or NTU for med school?
^Nothing conclusive, aside from the straight As I’ll need to pull.
^Which we knew already.. you know, some of my church friends are in med school.
^You guys should meet and get a better idea.
^Urgh I don’t even know anyone else who is going to med school or applying for it.
^That’s not true. Allison is in med school, you’ve met Brandon’s sister before.
^Um, hardly. Only that one time at the class barbecue last year at his place.
^I can help you ask if you want. Ally, or my church friends.

c-2: ^  I don’t really want anyone in school to know I’m poking about med school.
c-3: ^ I’m not really ready for people to know I’m poking about med school.

g-1: ^I still don’t understand why you’re secretive about it.
^Hello! What if I don’t get in?
^I’ll need the straightest of As, and be very impressive with the applications —
^You already get the straightest of As.
^I don’t know many people who try and go to med school.
^You have friends and family who do.
^Which is also why I’m NOT. Psych is really more for me I think. Digging into people’s heads.
^Yeah well. It feels like a club, and I’m on the outside.
^You definitely belong to the club. You just don’t know it yet.
^I’m the one with the family and friends of doctors right?
^You’re in their tribe, I can tell. It’s just the exams and application you need to get past.
^Of course I am. Now are you going to have the rest of your tempeh?
^Wait a minute. Is he really coming for my plate with his chopsticks?

nadia_1_3a: ^(Jokingly) Eh, who said I was done!
^Please, like you haven’t been eyeing it since just now.
^Wait, that’s everything — have you eaten enough?
^Haha yes, I was going to pass you the rest anyway.
^God bless tempeh and sambal. This is SO good.
^I guess. I really wanted chicken rice, but they always close early.
^So.. actually the issue was cos you were having bak chor mee.
^Your bak chor mee. And your chopsticks. Which were handling..
^Oh! Oh crap. The chopsticks were not halal.

c-0: ^ Yeah. Well not the chopsticks, but it’s fine —
c-1: ^ Not just that, the bak chor mee that you were eating with them is not halal.
g-0: ^Geez, I’m sorry Nad. It totally slipped my mind. I really forgot.
^No, I mean it! I usually remind myself cos I know it’s important to you, but —
^— today the tempeh called out to you?
^Haha, yes. Can we blame the tempeh?
^(Laughs) Sure, let’s blame the fermented soybeans.
^So, what if I was having chicken rice? Is it still the same?
^It depends.. If it’s the school chicken rice, even though it’s not halal, I’m more okay with it.
^Because they only sell chicken rice? And not the other one, the red coloured pork..
^Yes, that one! With char siu in the picture, then all becomes VERY not halal.
^My sister’s friends are chill with that. When they come over to hang out, my mum makes bee hoon.
^It’s tricky, and you never want to be the person making things difficult.
^You always worry too much about what other people think.
^I’m NOT saying it doesn’t matter. It just sucks. I wish you didn’t have to care.
^Ok, then what if you be the one deciding where to eat? That settles things right?
^I hate that sometimes too. It’s a lot of pressure.
^How are we going to hang out?

c-2: ^ (Still confused) If not in school, then where?
^Like.. a cafe? We can take a study break this weekend.
c-3: ^We’re on track with our study plan. We can take a break this weekend.

g-1: ^Sunday? I have church in the morning, but maybe afterwards..
^DID HE JUST ASK ME ON A...

nadia_1_3b: ^Hold up. Gavin, what were you just eating?
^Geez, relax. I know I had bak chor mee, but the chopsticks are clean what.
^Red stall, red plate. Green stall, green plate. No crossing!
^(Jokingly) Yeah, but the tempeh is right at the corner.
^I can pick it up without touching anything. See --
^Hey, can you stop? I’m still eating.
^Wow. Chloe was not kidding when she said you can be particular.
^Like you know, how you get hangry when your food is threatened, or not a certain way.
^Yeah, you know angry when you’re hun-

c-0: ^ I'm not angry. But that doesn't mean I don't want my space and beliefs respected.
c-1: ^ It’s not hangry to want my space and beliefs respected. Right?
g-0: ^Ok ok, I hear you. Chopsticks, down.
^I’m sorry ok? I do this with my other Malay friends too.
^So I thought you’d be fine with it.
^I guess they’re ok with it. I’m not..
^He looks really sorry. This guy is so dramatic.
^So.. do you want to meet my church friends? NUS vs NTU med school?
^You know what? Thanks Gavin. Only if you’re sure they won’t mind.
^(Beams) Not at all! You’ll really like them, promise.
^I’m probably meeting them on Sunday early evening.
^Do you want to join us and then you can ask them all the questions you want?
^Great! We can also meet earlier and hang out before?
^You know, in case you’re nervous to meet them.
^Yeah and you can brief me on them? Help me think of smart questions, ok?
^You’re already pretty smart. Don’t show me up! I can pick you up after church.
^Say 2pm? We can get coffee... maybe some cakes.

nadia_1_3c: ^Nah, you might as well take the rest.
^(munchmunchmunch) You sure you had enough to eat? What’s wrong?
^It’s fine. It’s not like I could have eaten the rest.
^I didn’t know you don’t like tempeh.
^We make quite a pair huh? I can help you finish all the stuff you don’t eat.
^Awww. And you still gave me yours. How ‘bout the next time we hang...you can eat all of mine.
^As long as we eat it with chopsticks from the Malay stall.
^Huh? -pause- Oh wait. Did I..oh no. Sorry! I should have used the halal ones.

c-0: ^ Well the chopsticks used to eat halal food, yes. And definitely not the ones you used to eat your bak chor mee.
c-1: ^ It’s not the cutlery that is halal..you know that right?
^It’s a little more than just no pork. But in this case, yes. You were eating bak chor mee.
g-0: ^So, if I had eaten the chicken rice instead, would that have been ok?
^That’s a good question...maybe there’s still hope.
^It depends.. If it’s the school chicken rice, even though it’s not halal, I’m more okay with it.
^Because they only sell chicken rice and not pork.
^Ok, so you’re more “No Pork, No Lard”?
^My sister’s Indonesian friends are like that. When they come over to hang out, my mum makes bee hoon.
^This really should be more straightforward to answer but..
^Everyone’s on their own faith journey. So you know, I can’t speak for them, or judge.
^For me, it’s also about being considerate.
^Because your chopsticks touched my plate and utensils, they’ll need to be cleansed by the stall owner.
^Sorry Nad, I really wasn’t paying attention. But I’ll do better. Are we ok?
^Yeah, we are. Just no more stealing my food k? I can get really hangry.
^PROMISE! Actually...how about I make up for stealing your food this weekend?
^Let’s go out for lunch. Or just coffee, maybe?
^It’s only fair exchange for a very rude food theft!
^Also we’ve been mugging for weeks. We can take a break.
^I can meet you after church. I think there are some halal cafes in the area.
^Errr, ya sure. I guess I’m free.
^K, let me do some research and then I’ll text you the time and place to meet.
^...did I just say yes to a date?

nadia_2_intro: ^I’m still a little surprised by what happened with Gavin.
^Not the chopsticks thing - but the invitation to go on a date!
^I guess it never occurred to me that he might like me enough to ask me out.
^There are still so many questions in my head - and Azlin is right, I need to remember who I am.
^But maybe for this one moment, I can just enjoy being with him without worrying about all that.
^And maybe I can show who him who I am outside of school, when we’re not studying in the library.
^I hope he likes what he finds.
nadia_2_1_narration: ^I’m running late - this is SO not me!
^But I also don’t usually take so long to decide on what to wear.
^Or go on dates! Ok, just breathe. Let's commit to this.
nadia_2_1: ^Hallo! Wanna head out this afternoon for a mug sesh?
^That’s ok! What are u up to?
^Oh chey, bo jio.. Are you two studying without me!
^I can’t believe you didn’t tell me!!!
^and what if it isn’t? You know??

^Hahahaha then it is a date la! 🎉🎉🎉
^So...  what’s your date fit? Are you doing matching lewks
^Huhu I think it can be cute leh.

^Right... sending through my selfie with this caption!

c-0: ^I’m turning up like this. Ok right?

c-1: ^No no you still look super cute! Just forgot that you wear a headscarf these days (?)

^It's never really come up with him. But he should be "okay with it"... right?
g-0: ^There's only one way to find out.

nadia_2_2: ^Oh! He’s reaching out for a hug.

nadia_2_2a1: ^Gee thanks. You clean up well too. So where’s this cafe?
^It’s just outside, I heard they have really good tempeh —
^Was worth the look on your face though.
^Am I though? I recall it was someone else being very protective that day.
^Hahaha... Ok ok, I’m done with this.
^You really do look nice by the way.
^That I look.. different today, than how I would in school?
^True. I don’t think it’s a big deal.
^Hahaha... Ok fine, but that’s just because I was a bit surprised.
^I didn’t know you wear a.. tudung outside of school.
^Ugh, fair. I just don’t want anything to be made a big deal.

^How does your head make everything sound so simple.

nadia_2_2a2: ^Gee thanks. You clean up well too.

^Always. You don’t get into student council without some heavy lifting.
^Hey, if you had biceps like mine, you’d flex too.
^Ehhh. I saw your smile from a mile away ok? You were super easy to spot.
^I just looked for the shortest, most energetic person walking towards me. That, and that tatty bag of yours.
^But seriously though, is everything ok with you? You seemed a little off when we said hi.
^I’m wearing my hijab and it’s best not to be seen hugging when I have it on.
^Ah! Noted. My bad. I will keep five steps apart from you at all times.
^Wow. There’s no need to be that extreme.
^I mean, I will try my best but you know, coffee tables are closer than that.
^Righttt. So, this really doesn’t bother you?
^Your...tudung? No, why should it? I mean, I know you’re pretty religious and faith is important to you.
^We all know how operation tempeh went down.
^I think it’s great that you’re confident in who you are.
^Wow. I wish I had mentioned it earlier. I took WAY too long trying to decide whether to wear it or not.
^Lol, was that why you were late? I thought you were having second thoughts about meeting.
^No, I’m pretty sure I want to be here.
^So...is there anything else I need to know about what we can or cannot do?
^Yes, here’s an important one. We can’t get lost looking for coffee. Are you sure you got the right directions?
^Eh...did I say left or right just now? Maybe we missed the turn...
nadia_2_2b: ^This mall is such a maze. Where on earth is that cafe?
^Wait a minute. Is someone calling my name?
^We carry on making our way to the cafe. The mall is a maze to get through, when a familiar voice breaks through the crowd.
^Oh hey! What are you doing here?
^No seriously, what is she doing here? Ok she’s just standing there, she’s waiting for me to come over.. with Gavin.
^It’s my cousin, let me just go over and say hi.
^Darn it Gavin! Fine, let’s do this.
^Seriously, what were the odds? Azlin looks so gleeful -- just look at that grin on her face.
^I’ll never hear the end of this.
^K, just be steady... she salam me (traditional Muslim greeting), I salam her...
^Uh, I'll have to talk to him later about this.
^PLEASE do not say “I’ve heard so much about you.”
^We’re going to grab coffee.. There’s this halal cafe that just opened up.
^Oh really? I thought you were more of a tea person, Nad.
^uh... I mean, I drink tea at home cos it’s there, but I do like.. Coffee.. At cafes.
^Ooh, fancy. No kopitiam kopi for you?
^You’re welcome! Ok, I’ll get to my errands now. Text me later!
^We’re in the clear! Oh no, Gavin is trying to salam her again...
^That’s right Azlin, just ignore and walk away.
^Sorry about that. The salam thing - er, you don’t have to salam Azlin.
^You don’t do that when you’re a guy and she’s...
^It’s fine, she was definitely more kaypoh to meet you. It’s nothing offensive or rude.
^How come there are so many invisible rules?
^Cultural... customs. Habits. Adat, which means behaviour of.. being polite.
^Ugh why must you make everything sound so formal?
^(Bewildered) Well yeah, but it is. I had no idea Malay people were so formal.
^Why, because we just sit downstairs at void deck with guitar all?
^Oi don’t put words in my mouth -
^— ok fine, but just because you don’t know about it doesn’t mean it doesn’t exist.
^And I’m just trying to understand how come I never knew any of this before.
^Hahaha... I love that we can laugh together, until it almost hurts...
^All that tension -- gone, at least for now.
^Is it always going to be like this?
^So I have to tell you something.
^I am.. Chinese. I’m sorry if you didn’t notice before.
^Oof, let’s save that for another day.
^It’s ok, I’m the one who got a bit..
^Anyway these things, it’s sort of - no need to say one. It’s just how we are around family.
^You grow up with it. So when you were so confused by it, and suddenly I have to explain things that usually no need to say.. it rattled me, actually.
^I feel like an idiot saying this. But maybe only just now did I realise: eh, we really are very different.
^Haha so I was kinda right, you really did just realise I’m Chinese.
^Yeah, I do. I feel a bit of it. Funny huh, we spend some much time hanging in school.
^(smiles) Ok. I don’t hate ALL new feelings.
^(beams) Good. Can’t believe we bumped into your cousin. Are you sure she’s not stalking us?

c-0: ^I wouldn’t put it past her. How about we go hide somewhere?
^Ooh I don’t know. How caffeinated do we want to be?
^Haha, you’re right - I feel quite awake already after all that.
^We end up watching the latest Thai horror movie.
^I think Gavin liked it. He grabbed my hand at a jump scare...
^And didn’t let go for the rest of the movie.
c-1: ^Not if it means we’re going to be walking around this mall looking for the place, haha.
^Yeah and it’s so crowded today! How about.. A movie?
^We end up watching a very strange and silly movie.
^He didn’t try to hold my hand or anything. Everything was just comfortable, and.. nice.

nadia_2_3_narration: ^It’s the start of the school week, and I’m in the library in between class periods.
^Chloe said she was going to speak to a teacher, then join me here 20 minutes ago.
nadia_2_3: ^idk what I’m gg to tell my mum
^Just finished. I’m gg to sit here and stone for awhile k
^idkkkkkkk I don’t even feel like studying anymore
^:( well i’m gg to be in the library ok?
^You take your time la. I brought snacks, if that helps...
^I don’t know. Maybe I’m being dramatic.
^Maybe not now. I think.. I’d rather hear about your date  👀👫
^Ah! Haha yes, um it was nice. Normal.
^Wow, please hold back on the details!! 😂
^Ok fine, fine. Then you come down here la!
^Kinda the same, kinda really different.. Did you see this coming?
^Only like, finally. You guys have been into each other for ages! The banter is non-stop with you two.
^Cos I didn’t want to accidentally force something into happening, if it wasn’t going to happen.
^In case it doesn’t work out.. because she doesn’t think it will?
^Did he say anything about you know, wearing a headscarf?
^Strangely.. it went ok. I was so nervous! Who knows what he really thinks of it. But he didn’t freak out. So there’s that at least.
^It’s just so frustrating, I feel like I’ve been trying to do everything right but it’s still not going to be good enough.
^I have.. been hoping to apply for overseas scholarships.
^My mum keeps bugging me about it. So I’ve been asking some teachers.
^Everybody is saying to just try la, what’s the harm right. But I don’t want to waste my time!
^If my chances are going to be lousy, I want to know so I can figure something else out.
^Argh, I hate that this is stressing you out.
^I know right! My mum is convinced that it’s the route to go for.
^Why does your mum think this way?

nadia_2_3a: ^Why is she so fixed on scholarships though? But is it though?
^Well, all her friends keep talking about it too I guess.
^They have kids our age, in other JCs or already on scholarships.
^Tell me about it! I’ve never even met these guys, but I probably can tell you their life stories based on what my mum tells me.
^Who got through DSA, who transferred out, who didn’t get into med school here and now it’s costing a bomb to go overseas..
^Oh boy. Should I tell her about med school?
^No, this is about Chloe not me.
nadia_2_3a1: ^Ok, I have to tell you something.
^I’m going to try for med school too.
^I mean, you know how tough it’s going to be.
^The hours are mad long though, you’re gonna sacrifice a lot.
^That’s what they tell me on TV.
^It’s real! And what if a patient DIES. I could never do it, and I don’t think you’re the GP doctor sort either.
^If somehow I get the grades to get into med school.. Then that’s the best use of it. You know?
^If you get those grades, you could go anywhere! What about law?
^I guess a Dr. Nadia does makes more sense for the universe.
nadia_2_3a2: ^All this sounds really stressful.Well.. how do you feel about this scholarship situation?
^Totally. It’s lLike I’m being pushed for something that I can’t really argue against.
^But you’re so good at arguing with your mom.
^Well this one isn’t as fun. I mean, it’s GOOD to get your name on a scholarship right? That means you’re someone.
^Ya! Not that I like it, but it’s the game, and you gotta make smart moves.
^(Doubtfully) Ok, assuming you’re right.. why do you think you’re not in the game anymore?
^So I was talking to the HOD just now about the scholarship I’m applying for. You know he’s the super honest type. No bullshit.
^Said that based on his past students and how they did.. I don’t have enough on my track record.
^Ya something along the lines of ‘showcase self-initiated community projects with impact’.
^Maybe I shouldn’t have spent all my time with hockey. Should have joined student council like you and Gavin..
^But you LOVE hockey. And you think student council people are annoying and idealistic.
^Correction - everyone else, aside from you and Gavin.
nadia_2_3b: ^But what do you think? That’s the most important thing.
^You always say she ends up being right.
^It’s so annoying! Like I’m being pushed for something that I can’t really argue against.
^Hmm.. Well.. d do you want a scholarship?how do you feel about this scholarship situation?
^Well..That it’ll be really cool to study overseas.
^Right? You get to do that, and have a career set and planned.
^Would you still go overseas without a scholarship?
^Maybe.. I think we could, but it really is so expensive.
^Oh boy. Med school is expensive too.
^Chloe, should I be looking at scholarships too?
^I didn’t know you wanted to go overseas too!
^Oh no, no, I’m probably going to stick to the local unis. But hoping to apply for.. med school.
^Really? I guess I can see that happening..
^Yeah, sure. It is pricey though, I heard it’s like three times more than other degrees.
^Oh boy, and you’re also going to be doing more years in school too. The unis have scholarships too, you can try for that?
^You know, and if somehow med school doesn’t work out.. I mean, they shortlist more than 1,000 applicants, then only offer less than 300 spots.
^Isn’t your cousin in nursing? That’s good right?
^Yeah she is, but not through NUS.
^Well I guess we’re both on the same track.

nadia_2_3c: ^Gee, thanks. Well.. scholarships are competitive, but so are you! Your essays are laser sharp.
^It’s not enough. Just wish I had a bit of an advantage.. Anyway, you won’t understand.
^Well, it’s different for you. You’ll probably have an easier time getting a scholarship too.
^Nad, it’s easier for you to get into things.
nadia_2_3d: ^Argh it’s so unfair. You fill the quota, you know?
^I can’t do this right now.  I need to escape this conversation somehow.
^Oops, I have to go home early.
^My mum just texted, says she needs me for something. You’re ok right?
^I can’t believe what Chloe just said. TO MY FACE!
nadia_2_3d1: ^Wow. I can’t believe what my friend just said to me
^Argh too long to type la, can we meet later please
nadia_2_3d2: ^Argh too long to type. Can we meet later please
^wow. later we get ice cream from the mama shop k. cool you down a bit
nadia_2_3e: ^Don’t make me say it.. it’s like HDB quota ok. It’s always easier if you’re Malay or Indian.
^Are you sure? How do you even know this?
^Right, you don’t have any siblings... my sister is trying to BTO and it’s crazy hard.
^Especially if you want to get a good location. It’s damn competitive! You’re so lucky you’re Malay.
^If you’re not Chinese, you can just swoop right in. Somehow there’s always space in the quota for Malay or Indian.
^Chloe, I don’t think it works that way. I have family and older cousins who live in HDBs. I’m pretty sure they don’t have an easy time.
^Why am I getting angry? Maybe I need to find an excuse to walk away.
^Huhu terjumpa (found) photo of Nadia when she was small 🌱👶🐛🦋
^[Thumbnail image: Nadia aged 6, dressed in a kid’s doctor’s coat. She is not looking at the camera. Instead, her full attention is to a teddy bear that she is examining with a toy stethoscope.]
^From young my girl already have ambition! Study hard and achieve your dreams. 🤲
^Insyaallah, you will become a doctor and then you can really help people. It is the MOST noble profession. Any hospital would be lucky to have you!
^Woah, where did that speech come from?
^Reply to the group chat and thank your dad

c-0: ^Thank you Abah. I will try my best 🙏

nadia_2_3e1: ^kembang, like you know, your head getting all big 🙃 oi i didn’t know your malay was this bad hahaha
^I KNOW what kembang (flower) is, and I’m not okayy 😑 It’s just my dad la, he can be very over
^lol memang. anyway joking only. u really are working for it.
^don’t be like that! i really was just teasing a bit. u ok tak?
^Tough day. Some really weird conversations. Wanna hang out today?
nadia_2_3e2: ^Why is my dad being so drama on wa
^best what, your abah so proud of you
^He really cannot maintain seh. He doesn’t get it la!
^aiya, it’s just a cute photo. i think everyone will focus on that. and not his monologue. haha
^“and then you can really help people” 😤 Like only doctors do that?? Hospitals only run on doctors?
^nothing I haven’t heard from him before 🙃
^it’s fine 👻 eh i’m off today. potong ice cream session this evening?
^Yes plssss. You won’t believe what this friend said to me today!
^fuyoo. k, text you later? usual spot.
nadia_2_4_narration: ^This is where we always meet, ever since Azlin moved into the same neighbourhood as me.
nadia_2_4: ^So.. are you sure this is not about Gavin?
^Sorry if I gave you a hard time that day when I bumped into you all. Hope I didn’t make it awkward.
^Ok I was, just a little. He seems nice, although when he -
^tried to salam you! I died a bit.
^But it was kinda cute. Clearly he knows who he needs to impress. Or try to. Smart guy.
^It wasn’t that awkward right? I explained to him afterwards, and it’s so weird to suddenly need to even explain these —
^STOP. You’re obsessing. It was fine. Also I thought you said this wasn’t about Gavin.
^You’re right. I need to unclench. I wanted to talk to you about...
nadia_2_4a: ^..what Chloe said. Like it doesn’t even make sense!
^I couldn’t even say anything back you know, I was stunned - like has she always felt this way? Is that really how she thinks?
^Ok ok, one thing at a time. This Chloe person, your volleyball friend?
^Well she’s been obsessing about scholarships and this afternoon, she was really ticked off by something. I was just trying to talk to her.
^Chloe said.. she thinks that I get accepted into things. Because I’m Malay. That I would fill their quota, so that’s why they would want me.
^I don’t even know! But Chloe thinks that I have it easier, that it’ll be easier for me to get into things, and that -
^she has to work harder than you. That’s some crazy shit.
^Ya it is. I’m sorry Nad, but your friend - does she even live in the real world? Nonsense seh!
^That’s what I couldn’t believe! She’s so level-headed, reasonable, I didn’t think she was so -
^Not that. I didn’t think.. she would see race. Like we’re such good friends.
^She knows we both work super hard to get where we are. How can she think I have it easier?
^Does she also think we don’t have to pay school fees? Or that we get special treatment?
^I was digging around before I did my nursing diploma. Betul ke? What is this that people who are never Malay always like to say?
^Isn’t it just one of those things taxi uncles like to complain about.
^I found out.. It’s half-true, which is always the problem kan.
^We don’t get free education. That rumour is just rubbish. BUT. There is a government subsidy.. if you’re Malay, and trying to get diploma or degree.
^I know kan. Asked myself that also, and then I saw the max household income if you nak qualify. You know how much? $2000.
^ya, is not a lot. Like if you qualify kan, that means there wasn’t money floating around to anyhow get a diploma.
^But still.. why this special subsidy? And just for us? Because we’re what, native to Singapore?
^No, Nadia. Because more of us, more Malay people, are poor.
^(Confused) That isn’t - I don’t think.. But we’re not poor because we’re Malay.
^Ya obviously. You, me and the next door neighbour also know that.
^Doesn’t change the fact that when there’s a charity drive, and got photos on Facebook, the faces all Melayu.
^And when there’s somehow a success story -
^then all over Berita Harian. Masyarakat Melayu boleh maju. Malay people can succeed! Haha, might be you next time.
^Argh, I hope not.. I want to be a doctor. But I don’t want it to be a big deal because I’m Malay. Suddenly becoming a poster.
^It’s all the stories, with the money problems, the drug problems. Then, when there’s an achievement..
^They shout it out to the whole kampong. Look what this person managed to do! You can do it too!!
^You managed also though. That says something kan? Put in the effort, work hard, and things get better.
^Maybe other people don’t want to try hard enough.
^Why are so many of us poor, until government give us special treatment? How come?
^I don’t know. But once you’re not doing well, with money problems, it’s harder to get out.
^But it’s also personal decisions, right? Maybe it’s other people and their decision-making that’s.. not good.
^Maybe always living beyond their means. Maybe a lot of them don’t know how to be responsible.
^(Getting pissed) Who are you talking about?
^No one.. But you know, Cik Lina’s family - I know they have money problems, but when I see them, phones all macam baru je.
^But it’s true though! Every Hari Raya also must change curtains.
^Ya something you noticed. Doesn’t mean you understand. How people spend their money is not our business.
^Not if that’s why they keep being stuck!
^Let me tell you something. Those phones kan, it’s all secondhand okay.
^It’s the thing that they can have and feel like everyone else. Have you ever met up with them?
^Right. When you do, you meet them at MRT station. Because they’re on top-up, not phone plan.
^They want to use public wifi. They all work part-time. Do you?
^I’m not, but that’s also why I’m not spending money anyhow.
^And your coffee latte or bubble tea all whatever, that one come from where? Pocket money from your abah kan.
^School fees? Next year when you go uni?
^I can take my own bank loan -
^but you don’t have to. That’s the difference. They have “new” phones, but at home no internet. You know how difficult that makes school and work?
^I know my family has it easier.
^Your family can afford to make decisions easier. You don’t have to calculate many small decisions just to make one big one.
^You don’t think I want to get a degree like you? I see my colleagues, they all can climb higher with degree.
^You thinking of doing degree next time?
^How to? Now my income finally dah stable, if I go back to nursing school - who’s going to pay the house bills?
^See how that works? Because I’m being responsible, right?
^When you don’t have much, it is so much more difficult to step up.
^no, just because you’re Malay doesn’t mean you understand. You and your father, always thinking you’re so different from the rest of us.
^Sorry - not different. You think you’re better than the rest of us.
^Maybe. I’m gonna go. I’ll see you around.
nadia_2_4b: ^..what my dad said. He really open mouth only.
^It’s like that. Haha remember that time when he said - anyone can become a nurse.
^Like easy only. Take blood pressure only, help people go toilet only.
^It’s fine. I just close eyes, close ears. I’m happy as long as I get to work.
^How’s your mom? She still wants you to kahwin and quit?
^Ya, she still makes noise. Say I already with my boyfriend so long, not good to drag and drag.
^I just diam and make sure I don't complain about work in front of her.
^She won’t understand. Think it’s better to just get married, have kids. Then like magic, all the problems disappear.
^But it’s not anymore. I like my work. I don’t want to be just a housewife.
^Although right, yesterday, I almost told her about this patient. Problem seh! Everything busy already, then want to create trouble.
^Wanted to change nurses. Patient didn’t want my colleague to touch her. Because my colleague Indian.
^What! And you had to follow the request?
^Ya la, patient still need medical care. I had to step in just to get the job done.
^My colleague so upset seh. Want to maintain my own face also difficult. Next time when you’re a doctor, you also must learn.
^Arghhh, how do you do it? When people are rude, I really cannot! Just now already with Chloe, I wanted to just let go seh.
^She was telling me... get this. She was telling me it is easier for me to get into things.
^Uni applications, scholarships. Because I’m Malay. That there’s some magic quota I help fill.
^People still think that way? All through poly I heard that. At least she told you to your face.
^In my time, everyone just paggro whisper behind my back. And when you do well, people low-key surprised.
^Sounds like my Maths teacher. Saying I’m good at the subject. “Very rare,” she said. How you tahan like that?
^You just hold your breath and smile. Shield up. Ignore their nonsense. Waste time only to get so worked up.
^But so geram! For Chloe to think I will have an easier time, that she has to work harder than me - when every day, I feel a bit... lost.
^Gavin and Chloe all have family and friends who went through JC, scholarships, uni. They know what’s coming up. I don’t, not really.
^I don’t mean it that way! Without you around, I would feel even more alone.
^With all the stories from your work, at least I know I’m not really imagining things.
^It’s funny right. You can work harder than everyone else, but you slip up one time, or giving yourself a break, and in front of the wrong person -
^they will think it’s because she’s lazy, or not very smart.
^Gavin told me some time ago.. He told his mum I hadn’t been in school and she said, “wah JC still can like that?”
^Her first thought was that I was anyhow skipping classes, not that I was sick.
^I don’t know. This was very long ago, maybe he didn’t know what to make of it. She also told him to spend less time with me.
^Ya. He said it like it’s funny, cos his mum was concerned about me being a bad influence and not being serious about school.
^I don’t even want to think about it. Or whatever Chloe might actually think of me.
^Well, it wasn’t really a fight-fight. I just left the conversation halfway. I felt so uneasy about it.
^Wow you JC kids really think far ahead ah.
^No, no way, not like that. It’s Chloe, she said I can get the scholarship easier just like how Malays get HDB ballots easier.
^Is that true? But Cik Lina had a hard time when she was applying for a flat.
^It’s hard for everyone la. People always think just because there’s a quota to buy a flat, that means we can always get any flat.
^People always want what they can’t have.
^They don’t see that other side. Next time if you need to sell your flat, you can also only sell to a very small group of people.
^You can never get a good price because there’s not enough people to make a demand.
^But if you can buy and sell from anyone, then you can have more people who are willing to compete to give you a better price.
^Aiya, you don’t worry about this now. Just focus on getting into med school.
^Just remember that people are always looking for excuses to blame others, especially if they feel threatened.
^Don’t give them that chance, keep your head down.
^But if they’re wrong, shouldn't I correct them? It’s not right to let things slide, when something isn’t fair or they have the wrong idea.
^Like when I said nothing and took over my colleague’s racist patient? Sometimes you just get on with it.
^That’s different, that was out of your control.
^Did Gavin say anything to his mum when she thought you were a bad influence?
^You remind me of me when I was younger. But you learn la Nads. The world doesn't care how much you fight.
^It just wants you quiet and compliant. Penat you know? Focus on your A’s. Maybe Gavin is nice, but... Save yourself the heartache.
